name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Carson City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located at the north end of town this is a rather new hotel. Like all new HIE hotels it has large bright looking rooms with all amenities. Everything was in good working order. Maid service was fine. There are some new HIE hotels that look more elegant than this one and have better furniture. But compared with the other choices in Carson City this is most likely one of the best, if not the best. Not to forget: Everything is very clean.
reviews.title: New, clean, bright looking

reviews.text: This hotel is very clean. It seems to be a good value for the area in the $120 per night range. It is quiet and easy to get in and out of. High speed internet works great and is easy to get connected.
reviews.title: Good Value
Many pluses, two minuses
reviews.text: I love this hotel. The pool was ice cold and the a/c was not continuous, though it was nicer than a standard Holiday Inn.

King Smoking Suite was well appointed with bar sink, fridge, microwave and 27" TV. Spacious room with good A/C. This Holiday Inn Express has the upgraded bedding that's pretty nice. However, even though you have a choice of pillows, they are still too puffy for me. I like a flatter pillow. Still, better than most hotels.
reviews.title: Nice rooms for the area

reviews.text: The high-speed internet in my room worked perfectly. Fast and connected every time. No dropped connections.
reviews.title: Nice experience

reviews.text: We checked in at this hotel at about 10:00 pm when we realized that we were not going to make it as far north that night as we had hoped. We were booked for a Holiday Inn Express in Redding, but decided to stay here instead. The staff was very helpful; they booked the room for the best rate they could and they even kept the pool and hot tub open a few minutes later than the normal 10:00 closing time so that we could soak our tired bodies in the hot tub before going to bed.
reviews.title: All-around great experience

reviews.text: We were really pleased with the size of the king-sized room, and we were even more pleased with the offerings at the continental breakfast the next morning--cinnamon rolls, bagels, toast, cereal, oatmeal, coffee, milk, 3 different kinds of juice... It was just what we needed before hitting the road again!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, poor service

reviews.text: I read the Trip Advisor comments after returning from our vacation and was surprised at the warnings listed for this hotel. Fortunately, we did not have one negative experience and were quite pleased to have found a new, modern accommodation in a town filled with old, seedy ones. We did not make advanced registrations; rather, after driving around Carson City early Thursday morning and rejecting six motels/hotels on sight, we walked into Holiday Inn Express and immediately received a room with two Queen beds for three adults. The price, with tax was $98.01. A continental breakfast included eggs, cereals, bagels, toast, hot cinnamon buns, juices, fruit, etc. There was more than enough for anyone to choose from. An attendant kept everything stocked and the area clean. We stayed on an upper floor that faced the major route going north to Reno. If you do book a room here, ask for one facing the back lot. Although the scenery of the mountains was great, hearing the trucks roaring by all night was a little disturbing. Other than that, our counter service was excellent, efficient, and most pleasing. (Perhaps, they fired the old Staff!) We had no trouble at all and based on "our" experience, would most likely stay there again.
reviews.title: Not A Bad Stay

likes.liked: — Modern, breakfast included, near Interstate, location to Carson City
likes.disliked: — Traffic noise in a room facing Interstate

reviews.text: We had booked a one night stay on the Holiday Inn central reservations website, and took care to print out the reservation confirmation with our rate clearly indicated.
reviews.title: Rude Management and Staff!!

reviews.text: What a joke. The front desk clerk and female manager on duty were rude, refusing to honor the rate, claiming it was a mistake. Not only were they rude, but they refused to let us use the house phone to call Holiday Inn Guest Services hotline for help!!
reviews.title: Great stay, enjoyed it

reviews.text: We finally contacted Guest Services on our own, and managed to get our reservation transferred to the Holiday Inn express in South Lake Tahoe.
reviews.title: Decent place, high rates

reviews.text: If you want to contend with rude Indian owners, who will cheerfully insult you and your mother, then this is the place for you!!!
reviews.title: Never Again!

reviews.text: Good location for visiting Virginia City and Carson City. Fresh baked cookies in the evening, decent breakfast with hot choices. Wasn't quite as clean as I would have liked, slipper bottoms were very dirty after walking one evening and one morning in our room. The desk staff were very pleasant and effecient. Indoor pool. Wireless Internet.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Carson City for one night in July and everything was fine. Rather new and very clean, friendly service, and the typical Holiday Inn Breakfast. Pool was very nice, too, and no inconsiderate guests to make the the lobby floor wet.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.text: It's a short drive to the city center (really only short), but I'd rather stay in a new clean hotel than in an older one in the center.
reviews.title: Disappointing Deficiencies

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I would say one of the best Holiday Inn Express I have stayed at.
reviews.title: Great place that I would stay at again

likes.liked: — Dogs were allowed and the room was super clean
likes.disliked: — Traffic noise (but it really wasn't all that bad)

reviews.text: There are several problems with this hotel. First, the hallway outside my non-smoking room was filled with the smell of smoke, and this seeped into the room, defeating the whole point of the non-smoking room. Second, the carpet in my room was filthy and battered, and should have long-since been replaced. Third, the hotel's swimming pool is right across a narrow hall from the elevator in the main lobby area, which meant that the area in front of the elevator (and sometimes the elevator itself) was often wet and disgusting thanks to the people who do not bother to dry themselves.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, met expectations

aka: Holiday Inn Express Hotel And Suites Carson City
description: Welcome to the Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Carson City, Nevada. We are conveniently located off scenic North Carson Street (Business 395) on the north end of Carson City across from the Green Golf Course near the Nevada Capitol Building, casino gaming and restaurants. This beautiful hotel is only 30 miles from Reno Tahoe International Airport and all Reno attractions, 30 miles from Lake Tahoe and 17 miles from Virginia City. Special in-room amenities are: free wireless high-speed Internet, 27' TVs with HBO and Pay-Per-View, microwave & refrigerator, 2 line phones with free local calls, work space, hair dryer and free parking. Luxurious granite appointments including bathroom surrounds, counter surfaces along with granite vanity tops were installed for a touch of class. We have 20 suites and a Honeymoon Suite, which come with a wet bar, separate living area, sofa bed, activity table and 2 chairs. Take a dip in our heated year around indoor swimming pool and spa . Other amenities include a fitness room, guest laundry and meeting facilities. Wired and wireless Internet is available in the lobby and in all rooms, pool and breakfast area.Visit Carson City, NV and Stay Smart at the Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites.There is a computer with Internet access in the lobby for guest use.
